column1: #Text=is a city in Bohemia in Western Czech Republic with a population of 33,500 and is close to the German border .
#Text=The name is pronounced " khep " ( the first sound like a German or Scottish " ch " or a Spanish " j " not as in " Chicken " - locals will make fun of you if you make this mistake ) .
#Text=The city features a very quaint and pretty town square and winding alleys .
#Text=However , outside of the center , the city is characterized by grimy heavy industry .
#Text=Direct buses run from Prague ( 150 Kč , 3 hours , 4 daily ) , Karlovy Vary ( 56 Kč , 1 hour , 7 daily ) , Mariánské Lázně ( 40 Kč , 30 minutes , 12 daily ) .
#Text=Built in the 19th century by several German railroad companies and run in cooperation until the end of WWII when Czechoslovak and later Czech authorities took over .
#Text=Direct trains run from Prague ( 250Kc , 3 hours , 3 daily ) .
#Text=There are local German trains from Hof , Nuremberg and Bayreuth .
#Text=Unfortunately , the line is not yet electrified on the German side , so long distance trains are still some ways of .
#Text=The center is easily accessible by foot .
#Text=Tu - Su : 10:00 - 18:00 ( no entry after 17:00 ) , closed on state holidays .
#Text=Mostly in ruins except for its towers .
#Text=Features the biggest Romanesque chapel in Bohemia .
#Text=Namesti Krale Jiriho z Podebrad - Main Square
#Text=New Town Hall & State Gallery of the Arts
#Text=Features the St. Clare Church and the Church of the Herald of the Virgin Mary .
#Text=A yearly nice jazz jam in festival format , held around October .
#Text=, Náměstí Jiřího z Poděbrad 35 ( Main square ) .
#Text=( 6km east of city center at Drenice ) .
#Text=, Svobody 32 ( Located in the pedestrian zone , towards the end opposite to the market square ) , ☏ +420354433216 , fax : +420354433494 , ✉ info@hotel-slavie.cz .
#Text=Friendly somewhat bigger hotel with a decent standard , however , nothing " fancy " .
#Text=a pittoresque town surrounded by a curve in the Ohře River , which you can well visit on your way to Karlovy Vary
